description:
Metarhizium robertsii ARSEF 23 is a fungal species that belongs to the genus Metarhizium, a group of entomopathogenic fungi known for their ability to infect and kill various insect pests. The ARSEF 23 strain is a specific isolate of M. robertsii, which was collected and maintained in the USDA-ARS Collection of Entomopathogenic Fungal Cultures (ARSEF).

M. robertsii ARSEF 23 is a filamentous, spore-producing fungus that can infect and cause disease in a wide range of insect hosts, including agricultural pests and disease vectors. The fungus is capable of penetrating the insect's cuticle, invading the host's body, and ultimately causing the death of the infected individual.

The ARSEF 23 strain has been extensively studied for its potential use as a biological control agent in various agricultural and public health applications. Researchers have investigated the fungus's pathogenicity, host range, and environmental persistence, as well as its ability to be formulated and applied effectively in field conditions.

This specific strain of M. robertsii has been the subject of numerous scientific investigations, contributing to the broader understanding of the biology, ecology, and potential applications of entomopathogenic fungi in integrated pest management strategies.
